newsitem.title: USA: N.Y. Power Authority sees 825 MW plant up Monday.
newsitem.headline: N.Y. Power Authority sees 825 MW plant up Monday.

text.p: New York Power Authority's 825 megawatt Poletti power station in Queens, N.Y., was expected to resume operation Monday after being shut late Thursday for repairs, the utility said on Friday.
"It'll be on line Monday morning," said spokesman Dick Matthews, adding the plant may restart even earlier.
The generating plant was shut about 1030 EDT Thursday after onsite crews discovered a boiler tube leak.
The Poletti station, the largest fossil-fueled plant operated by the state-owned utility, can burn either fuel oil or natural gas to produce electricity.
